intro: Tarachia platyneuron, commonly known as the desert nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants such as tomatoes and potatoes. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the evening, and its fruit is a fleshy, red berry that contains several seeds. It has adapted to harsh desert conditions with thick, waxy leaves that reduce water loss and allow it to survive in extreme temperatures.
